sen.j: 東儀家（とうぎ け）は、奈良時代から今日まで1300年以上の間、雅楽を世襲してきた三方楽所楽家（宮中・京都、南都・奈良、天王寺・大阪の楽師の家）の家系。
sen.e: The Togi family is one of the "Sanpo gakusyo" (organization of transmission of gagaku, ancient court music) "Raku families" (families of musicians served in the Imperial court in Kyoto, Nanto in Nara, and Tennoji in Osaka), which has passed down the tradition of "gagaku" (ancient Japanese court dance and music) for over 1,300 years from the Nara period to today.

The Togi family is one of the "Sanpo gakusyo" (organization of transmission of gagaku, ancient court music) "Raku families" (families of musicians served in the Imperial court in Kyoto, Nanto in Nara, and Tennoji in Osaka), which has passed down the tradition of "gagaku" (ancient Japanese court dance and music) for over 1,300 years from the Nara period to today.

The Togi family is one of the Sanpo gakuso (organization of transmission of gagaku, ancient court music) Gaku families (families of musicians served in the Imperial court in Kyoto, Nanto in Nara, and Tennoji in Osaka), which has passed down the tradition of gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) for over 1,300 years from the Nara period to today.
sen.cmt: Sanpo gakusyo→Sanpo gakuso、Raku families→Gaku familiesに修正、クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 堂上家することは許されない地下階級に属する下級官人の家系。
sen.e: The family belonged to the lower-ranking government official class called "Jige-ke" (family status of non-noble retainers who are not allowed into the Emperor's living quarters in the imperial palace).

The family belonged to the lower-ranking government official class called "Jige-ke" (family status of non-noble retainers who are not allowed into the Emperor's living quarters in the imperial palace).
The family belonged to the lower-ranking government official class called Jige-ke (family status of non-noble retainers who are not allowed into the Emperor's living quarters in the imperial palace).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 近衛府の下級の官職名を代々与えられていた。
sen.e: The family had been given for generations lower-grade job titles at the "Konoefu" (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).
The family had been given for generations lower-grade job titles at the "Konoefu" (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).
The family had been given for generations lower-grade job titles at the Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 遠祖は聖徳太子に仕えていた秦河勝とされるが、真偽は不明である。
sen.e: Although it is alleged that the ancestor of the family could be traced to HATA no Kawakatsu, a stalwart of Prince Shotoku, the validity of the allegation is yet to be identified.
Although it is alleged that the ancestor of the family could be traced to HATA no Kawakatsu, a stalwart of Prince Shotoku, the validity of the allegation is yet to be identified.
Although it is alleged that the ancestor of the family could be traced to HATA no Kawakatsu, who served Prince Shotoku, the validity of the allegation is yet to be identified.
sen.cmt: a stalwart of Prince Shotoku→who served Prince Shotokuとしました。

tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更
